Detailed Description

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
class stemming::danish_stem< string_typeT >

The Danish alphabet includes the following additional letters:
-æ å ø

The following letters are vowels:
-a e i o u y æ å ø

A consonant is defined as a non-vowel.

R2 is not used: R1 is defined in the same way as in the German stemmer.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::danish_stem< string_typeT >::operator() ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline]

Parameters:
text string to stem

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::danish_stem< string_typeT >::step_1 ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

Search for the longest among the following suffixes in R1, and perform the action indicated.

-hed ethed ered e erede ende erende ene erne ere en heden eren er heder erer heds es endes erendes enes ernes eres ens hedens erens ers ets erets et eret -delete

-s -delete if preceded by a valid s-ending

(Of course the letter of the valid s-ending is not necessarily in R1)

Define a valid s-ending as one of -a b c d f g h j k l m n o p r t v y z å

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::danish_stem< string_typeT >::step_2 ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

Search for one of the following suffixes in R1, and if found delete the last letter.

-gd dt gt kt

(For example, friskt -> frisk)

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::danish_stem< string_typeT >::step_3 ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

If the word ends igst, remove the final st Search for the longest among the following suffixes in R1, and perform the action indicated.

-#ig lig elig els
-delete, and then repeat step 2

-#løst
-replace with løs

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::danish_stem< string_typeT >::step_4 ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

Step 4: undouble If the word ends with double consonant in R1, remove one of the consonants.

(For example, bestemmelse -> bestemmels (step 1) -> bestemm (step 3a) -> bestem in this step.)

undouble consecutive (same) consonants if either are in R1 section
